headline: President Trump faces pivotal days at home and overseas
subHeadline: Trump narrows his shortlist to fill the Supreme Court seat being vacated by retiring Justice Anthony Kennedy and summit with Putin looms and Secretary Pompeo continues negotiations with North Korea; reaction and analysis on 'The Five.'

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Hello, everyone. I'm Dana Perino along with Kimberly Guilfoyle, Richard Fowler, Jesse Watters is back, and Tyrus. It's 5 o'clock in New York City, and this is "The Five." Fox News alert, another cabinet shakeup for the Trump administration, EPA administrator, Scott Pruitt has resigned. President Trump tweeting the announcement aboard Air Force One on his way to a campaign rally in Great Falls, Montana, which is coming up in about an hour from now. Of course, we'll have that for you live. John Roberts joins us from the White House with the latest. John, you can't ever take a break, you have to be on your toes at all times at the White House. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb2', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb2', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: JOHN ROBERTS, FOX NEWS
utterances.sentences: Your head has got to be on swivel 24/7 here at the White House. This is not a surprise. It's really been a long time coming. What has been a surprise to many, many people is how Scott Pruitt held on to his job as long as he did given the controversy that was swirling around him, 14 different ethics investigations. But in his farewell tweet, Scott Pruitt after his resignation, you can see why he held on because the President really appreciated what he was doing. President Trump tweeting, I accepted the resignation of Scott Pruitt as administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency. Within the agency Scott has done an outstanding job, and I will always be thankful to him for this. The senate confirm deputy at EPA, Andrew Wheeler, will take over on Monday, assume duty as the acting administrator of the EPA. I have no doubt that Andy will continue on with our great and lasting EPA agenda. We have made tremendous progress and the future of the EPA is very bright. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('mobile', 'ban2', 'mobile-mw-ad-ban2', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } Scott Pruitt issued his resignation in a form of a letter to the president. The Administrator Pruitt shared that letter with me. I think the particular excerpt from that letter, the passage from that letter that is important here is Pruitt saying I'm stepping down as administrator of EPA effective as of July 6. It is extremely difficult for me to see serving you in this role, first, because I count it a blessing to be serving you in any capacity, but also because of the transformative work that is occurring. However, the unrelenting attacks on me personally, my family are unprecedented, has taken a sizeable toll on all of us. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('tablet', 'lb3', 'tablet-tw-ad-lb3', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } It was well publicized all of the controversy and scandals that Pruitt has been facing, but there was another one that was facing him which may have been the most important at all. Congressman Ted Lou, as well as Don Baier had sent a letter to the inspector general at the EPA claiming that certain appointments in Scott Pruitt's calendar had been scrubbed from the official record because the meetings were with people that would have, quote, looked bad, in the federal record, and not keeping proper federal records can be considered to be a crime. So that was facing him, as well. Bernie Sanders of Vermont, a fierce critic of Administrator Pruitt, said Scott Pruitt was the worst administrator in the history of the agency. Congressman Tim Ryan, Democrat of Ohio, simply said it's about time in terms of Scott Pruitt's departure. Again, Dana, he held on where so many other people in an administrative capacity would not have been able to, simply because the president thought he was doing a good job. The president during the campaign railed against what he called onerous and duplicative federal regulation that were really handcuffing, he believe, industry from being able to create the sort of economy that President Trump thought was possible, and Pruitt was right there on the front lines of it cutting those regulations, certainly, earned him a lot of enemies in government, at the EPA. utterances.sentences: I'm in favor of the power nap.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Of course.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No, but not at work.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: One time you could be in the group, you just won't do it.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: No, I will not.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Very Juan of you. Very Juan of you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What's the difference between power nap, though, and a regular nap?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Power nap is --

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Seven minutes.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Twenty to 30 minutes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: It's shorter in duration.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: A regular nap is 90 minutes?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Thirty minutes?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: A regular nap is 90.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's, like, five news cycles in 30 minutes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Wait, who -- really?

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: There's a nap commission.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I thought there's like a science of -- I don't know.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: The science to have, like, a 30-minute nap so you get all the cycles right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You know who was a great napper?

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: What about resting your eyes? What is does that fall under? Because I'm good at that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Margaret Thatcher was an excellent power napper. She could just take, like, two or three minutes, and then she'd be back and ready to go.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That's amazing.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: All right. FOX News alert, President Trump just landed in Great Falls, Montana, ahead of his "Make America Great Again" rally, coming up at the top of the hour. We'll bring it to you live when it happens. Stay tuned to FOX News. There's a guy walking.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, we're talking?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, it doesn't say --

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: So power naps.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So Jesse, the president just arrived in Montana.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, so big rally tonight, 6 p.m., and I think it's going to be probably another stem winder, which will have the liberals apoplectic. And these rallies, he really connects with the base. Probably FOX News will take it live in full, and CNN will not take it and get destroyed in the ratings.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Let's talk about the race.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You're going to see more of the president.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Let's talk about the facts.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK, let me just finish. You're going to see more of the president coming up into the mid-terms on the road, connecting with the audience in these states where they need to flip the Democratic seats.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Well, the seat is actually going to be --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Putting a lot of pressure on these Democrats in these districts.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: This -- so this seat is actually going to be very hard to flip. He's --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. I have news. I'm told that -- so apparently, the president did a gaggle with reporters on the plane, and it was a couple days ago that he talked to Scott Pruitt, the now resigned EPA administrator. So the president that this resignation was coming. He was expecting it, and it is effective tomorrow, the sixth of July.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, some of his scandals were a little silly, like one of his scandals, that he made his staff get him snacks. I mean, if anybody's worked for any boss, the boss will sometimes make you get snacks. On the other hand, another scandal --

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: That's not against the law, though.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK, Richard, just relax.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: But it's against the law.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Another scandal, he spent $30,000 of taxpayer money on soundproofing his office, not a good look.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: How about the $5,000 on pens and journals?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's a lot of money on pens and journals.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Or sending his staff to buy a used mattress from the Trump Hotel.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm not going to defend Scott Pruitt's spending.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: But he's part of the Trump swamp.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I will say that it's going to be a smooth transition.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Well, he just got drained, though. That's a good thing, because he just got drained.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Two years. You can take --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: His -- his deputy is pretty good, and the Trump administration's environmental policies and conservation policies will still remain the same.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: But I thought Trump -- I mean, I thought Trump, like, sort of ran on the whole idea of draining the swamp, and this guy is the epitome of the swamp.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, he's not there anymore.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He's not there anymore.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Well, you can take a horse to water, but you can't make him fish. Right?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: This -- yes.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Joey Chestnut consumes over 20,000 calories in 10 minutes at this year's Fourth hot dog eating contest. Wow. "Kimberly's Food Court" is next.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: This is a FOX News alert. President Trump arriving in Montana for a campaign rally. And he's commenting on the resignation of EPA Administrator Scott Pruitt, saying the White House has been talking about it for a while, and it has been in the works for a couple of days. We're keeping an eye on that. But right now, it's time for "Kimberly's Food Court." Yes. All right. Well, he is the hot dog eating king once again. You know him, right? Joey Chestnut chowing down a record 74 hot dogs in 10 minutes at the Nathan's Famous July Fourth hot dog eating contest at New York's Coney Island boardwalk. It was the 11th time he won the coveted mustard belt. God, I wish I had that. Meanwhile, in the women's competition, Miki Sudo bested her competition by eating 37 hot dogs in three -- oh, 10 minutes. Well, that is pretty impressive.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Three minutes would have been amazing.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I think she's -- that's going to be --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I can't even watch that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Can you imagine? I think it's very impressive. It takes a lot of mental discipline to be able to eat that quickly.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: An amazing --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: This is a gorgeous graphic behind you. I just wish you would feast your eyes on this.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's pretty amazing.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes, and you know, as a competitive eater, that I am, I can tell you the preparation that goes in mentally, like, the night before. And you've got to be careful about your diet, what you have before you go into these competitions. We all were talking about what would he be, you know, competitive with, if we were going to be in one of these. Obviously, I feel very well-versed to do chicken wings, because I am the reigning champion around these parts.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: She is. Don't ever bet against her.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Dana --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Always ask her to be on your team. It's -- I've never seen anything like it. She is a competitor of the highest degree.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Highest order.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You'd want her on your team.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: No, I'm not playing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: "I'm not playing"?

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: I'm not eating that many hot dogs for nobody. I just -- I don't look at it as a real sport.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What did you choose if you were to have something?

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Oh, I chose pie, because everyone loves pie. But real quick, I actually did win a food eating contest one time in Laredo, Texas. I beat John Cena in a 72-ounce steak eating contest.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No way.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Smashed him.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That's pretty cool.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: How long did it take?

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: It was about -- about 30 minutes. A lot of side bets, but I was people's champion that night.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You're going to take a sample over there? No. Oh, you have the pie. Dana, this was hysterical.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I thought this was pretty funny, that I -- if I were to choose, like, what I could eat to win, I chose M&M's.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: You could eat like three?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No. You could eat a whole bunch of M&M's. If you're going by the number, then I could actually probably win if I did something like that.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: You'd have to use two hands to eat one M&M.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: This is hysterical. It's like, she's, like, cute and little, and like the M&M's are little.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I want to give these -- I'm giving these to Jesse for his office.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He'll eat all of those, for sure. Jess, what did you pick?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I got McNuggets.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes, you love those.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I was going to get shellfish, but I got scolded one time for doing that. So I went with --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Your first week.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Chicken nuggets and barbecue sauce, and I'm ready to take on all challengers. I know I'm the newcomer to the table, but that belt is not secure. That mustard belt, Kimberly --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I might be wearing that at the end of the show.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Are you talking about to compete with me? Because that would be foolish idea.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Would we have the same food or would we compete nuggets versus wings? How would it go down?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Well, I think either way, you would lose.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Are we doing this then? Because Richard chose shrimp cocktail. Which is ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: I did. I chose shrimp. Because --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: This is a salad.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: How are you going to eat that?

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: You totally botched this.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: I'm going to still beat y'all. Don't under -- don't underestimate me, America. Don't underestimate me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: In the minute or so that we have, should we -- should we have a throwdown?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm just going to start.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Go.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: His are, like, soft. Mine have all the hard part on there.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Who do you think is going to win?

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: I don't care. I'm going to eat pie.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Let them eat pie. Let them eat cake.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What did you say, Mina? Oh, one minute. OK, go.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Dana, you're not doing any of it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No, I'm not, because I'm emceeing this event.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: She can't. They're way too big for her.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Richard might win, because he is, like, throwing down, all that --

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: I'm telling you, shrimp is the way to go.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Jesse is kind of disappointing me.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I don't feel so well.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Look at -- look at, I'm going to win.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Low calories, people. Low calories.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: It's not even close.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: This was a bad idea.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's a big bite that you just took out of that pie.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: But I'm taking my time. It's pie. So you know --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Wow. She's going to win.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Yes. It's not even close.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: I'm in the lead here. I only have, like, two shrimps left.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I underestimated Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, I've told you, never, never bet against her.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: But you've got to eat all the salad, too, bro.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: No, that's not part of the rules. It is just approaching.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's just approaching.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, man. I don't feel so good.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Winner, winner, chicken dinner. "One More Thing" up next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: President Trump is on his way to a campaign rally in Montana. It's set to start at the top of the hour. Right now, it's time for "One More Thing." I'm going to go first, because I have a special guest. This is Spike. He's a service puppy for Canine Companions for Independents. He's really into Tyrus's arms. These are dogs that are much-needed. And the producer of "The Daily Briefing," Jen Williams, she's here, over there taking pictures. This is a five-month-old puppy that she is raising. She will take care of him for 18 months and make sure he hits all of his benchmarks, all the training. And then after that he goes to more specific training, where he will learn how to open doors, turn on and off lights, and learn how to take care of someone. Jen has had him since he was eight weeks old. And if you go to FOXNews.com/TheDailySpike, you'll learn more about Canine Companions for Independence. That's CCI.org. And then you can apply for a dog or, even better, you can apply to figure out a way to help this organization. A lot of people need dogs. And we love Spike. And this is his first time on "The Five." But I think he just wants Tyrus. OK, Jesse, you go next.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Tyrus has a new best friend.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He loves the chicken on him -- my chicken --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Just don't eat my nuggets. All right? Next, we have a bouquet gone wrong. You know how the brides throw the bouquet over, and the bridesmaids go nuts? Look at this scene. It was a wedding off Thomas and Deanna Morganthaler. I think we have the footage. And it's pretty wild.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Ouch! Was that a low bridge, or did she hit her high and someone else went low?

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Down goes Fraser. Down goes --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No one was hurt. And yes, I mean, it's competitive with the bridezillas out there, wannabe bridezillas. But everyone's OK, and happy wedding to the Morganthalers.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Indeed. All right. Kimberly, you're next.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Hi. All right. So this is very cute "One More Thing." And this video shows a Houston police officer dancing with a girl who's in a wheelchair at a party.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Aww.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: And this is a quinceanera party, and it's very cute. The DJ was working this quinceanera, and he looked up, and he spotted this sweet moment. The officer, Sandy Fernandez, was working as security for the event. He spotted the little girl in the wheelchair, watching everybody else dance. And so he then asked her to dance and spent about three songs twirling her around the dance floor. Fernandez said that she smiled the entire time for him. There were no words to describe the incredibly beautiful moment. And this was on the Houston Police Department Facebook page. And it says, "This is what relational policing is about." So far, 54,000 views.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I love that. And now millions more, thanks to you. A great "One More Thing." All right. Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: My "One More Thing" is "Greg Vacation News, Featuring Tyrus." The news is Greg's been bothering me with e-mails about a viral treat thread that -- while he's enjoying his Hawaiian vacation. For those of you who aren't familiar with the story, basically, a Texas couple asked to switch seats with a woman on a flight so they can sit together. And apparently, love was in the air. And they immediately hit it off, and they started tweeting about their stuff. Greg is convinced that this story isn't quite on the up and up and finds it a little suspicious. And which led to some e-mails back and forth. Meanwhile, I was frantically telling him, "Brah" --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Brah.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: "-- you're on vacation."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: "Be on vacation. The world can wait." But you know, Greg is such a visionary warrior for --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He can't stop. He likes to sniff out -- I thought that story was very sweet. That couple, they meet on the airplane, and then it's, like, romance. I met my husband on an airplane.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: I have my suspicions. I'm going towards hoax. The two people were fitness models looking for work. And the people doing it were actors. I feel like --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: -- we're being hoodwinked and bamboozled. And if not, I would be - - and what if it is real and one of those people were doing something they weren't supposed to be doing. And you're, you know, putting all their business out there.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You and Greg are skeptics. Dana and I believe in true love.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We do. We believe.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: We believe in it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Spike, do you believe in love? Richard, you're next.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: All right. So one of my new favorite shows on our sister channel, FX. It's called "Pose." It's set in the 1980s. "Pose" is a dance musical that explores the juxtaposition of the segments of life and society in New York. Making TV history, "Pose" features the largest cast of transgendered actors in a series regular roles, as well as the largest recurring LGBTQ actors ever in a scripted series. Trust me, you will love this show. You will laugh, you will cry, you will fall in love with it. Check it out. Big shout out to 21st Century FOX and FX Productions for taking a risk on this. You can catch it every Sunday night at 9 p.m., only on FX, our sister channel. It's pretty epic.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, we have a few seconds left, Tyrus. What do you think about your new best friend?

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Oh, man, I'll replace Greg with him in a minute.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Aww, very sweet.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Greg, if you're watching, stop watching. Stay on vacation.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: What about his selfie? It's pretty funny.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS
utterances.sentences: Yes, I kind of stay off of his social media. I've got to deal with him. I'm more obsessed with yours and all your cool photos and stuff. Like you're really shooting stuff.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What do you guys think of Spike? Anybody want to comment on this fabulous --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm just happy he's slobbering all over Tyrus and not me.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: And folks, during the break, you missed Jesse slobbering, because he almost choked on his chicken nuggets.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That is true.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Jesse's a wimp.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That is true. (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You know what? I have to hand it to Jesse. He was eating those nuggets, and they were cold.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: So were mine. What are the excuses here?

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: Wimp.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: What a snowflake.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: A snowflake wimp, America.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's it for us.

utterances.speaker: FOWLER
utterances.sentences: There you have it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Stay tuned for President Trump's rally, coming up. "Special Report" is up next. But before you see President Trump, you'll see Bret Baier -- Bret.
